page.title: 08"THE PLOUGH"
page.content: {"The Plough"}at Smallfield is owned by{Mr and Mrs Ford.}It is a country pub in{Plough Road. Mr and Mrs Ford have been publicans for 31 years.{Mr {Ford}decided to be a publican because his famliy were in the trade.{Mr Ford employs five full_time staff and up to twenty part_time staff. { "The}Plough" is open twelve hours a day.{Mr Ford}does not have a dart board but he has a fruit machine. He does not have a dart board because he was not getting any money from it. Instead he now has twelve seats and four tables. { Mr Ford}has 200 regulars and he also has a restaurant. As well as serving drinks{"The Plough"} sells snacks and sandwiches at lunch time.
